sentences.sentence: She would have stood next to him, and smiled at him, and he would have never left her side.
Then he would have played with her, and taught her all kinds of wonderful games.
Even though he had never been in a palace before, he knew many wonderful things.
He could make a flute( 长笛 ) out of bamboo to play music with.
He knew the song of every bird, and the footprint( 脚印 ) of every animal, and he always knew just where to find them.
Once he had found a nest( 鸟巢 ) full of baby birds, and he had raised them himself, and now they ate out of his hand( 听命于他 ) every morning.
The Infanta( 公主 ) would certainly like them, and all the other animals in the forest.
Yes, she must certainly come to the forest and play with him.
He would let her sleep in his own little bed, and would watch outside the window until the sun rose to make sure she was safe.
And after the sun rose he would wake her, and they would go out and dance together all day long.
It was really not at all lonely in the forest.
Certainly there was much to look at in the forest, and when she was tired he would carry her in his arms, because he was very strong, though he knew that he was not tall.
But where was she?
He asked the white rose, but it did not answer him.
The doors to the palace were all closed, and heavy curtains( 窗帘 ) had been pulled closed across the windows to keep out the hot afternoon sun.
He walked around looking for some place through which he might go inside, and at last he saw a little private door that was open.
He went through, and found himself in a wonderful hall.
He worried that it was even more wonderful than the forest.
Would the Infanta( 公主 ) leave this beautiful palace to be with him?
There was so much gold everywhere in the palace.
But the little Infanta( 公主 ) was not there, only some wonderful white statues( 雕像 ) that looked down at him, with sad white eyes and strangely smiling lips( 嘴唇 ).
At the end of the hall there was a door.
Perhaps she was in the next room?
He would try to look for her, at least.
He ran across the room and opened the door.
No! She was not here either. The room was quite empty.
It was a throne-room( 王宫大殿 ), which the King used when officials visited him from foreign countries.
The walls and ceilings( 天花板 ) were covered with gold, and up on a raised area was the King’s throne( 宝座 ).
This was a large and very beautiful chair, covered with fine black fabric( 织物 ), and edged with( 镶...边的 ) pearls( 珍珠 ) and with silver flowers.
On a step just below the throne( 宝座 ) was a seat for the Infanta( 公主 ), also made of fine fabric( 布料 ) and edged with( 镶...边的 ) silver.
But the little Dwarf( 小矮人 ) did not care at all about this throne( 宝座 ).
He would not have traded even one petal( 花瓣 ) on his white rose for the throne( 宝座 ) itself.
What he wanted was to see the Infanta( 公主 ), and to dance for her, and then to ask her to come away with him when he had finished his dance.
Here, in the palace, the air was thick and heavy, but in the forest the wind blew freely, and the leaves on the trees danced in the sunlight.
The flowers in the forest might not have been as lovely as those in the palace garden, but they smelled sweeter.
Certainly she would come, if only he could find her!
She would come with him to the forest, and all day long he would dance for her pleasure.
A smile lit up his eyes as he thought about this, and he passed into the next room.
Of all the rooms he had seen so far, this was the brightest and the most beautiful.
The walls were covered with fine fabric( 织物 ), onto which was sewn( 绣上 ) patterns( 图案 ) of brightly-colored birds and flowers.
The chairs and tables were all edged with( 镶...边的 ) silver, and the floor was made of a blue-green stone, and looked like a great sea in front of him.

question.cn: 日出后矮人想和公主一起做什么？
question.en: What did the Dwarf wish to do with the Infanta after the sun rose?

options.en: Go out and dance together all day long.

options.cn: 和她一起阅读各类书籍。
options.en: Read all kinds of books with her.
